title: What's News: World-Wide — WSJ
text:
This article is being republished as part of our daily reproduction of WSJ.com articles that also appeared in the U.S. print edition of The Wall Street Journal (September 30, 2019).

Tens of thousands of protesters poured onto Hong Kong's streets, with the fiercest battles in weeks breaking out as demonstrators faced off with police and shouted anti-China slogans ahead of Tuesday's 70th anniversary of the founding of Communist China.

Antigovernment protests in Hong Kong are stirring anti-China sentiment in Taiwan.

The whistleblower at the center of the impeachment probe of Trump will testify in the House "very soon," though in a way that will protect his identity, Schiff said.

Musk set forth an accelerated timetable for his proposed megarocket for travel to Mars, saying it could take humans on an orbital test flight as soon as next year.

Florida gun-control advocates are mobilizing to pass a ban on semiautomatic rifles with high-capacity magazines for the first time in a Republican-controlled state.

Israel's attorney general extended Netanyahu's pretrial hearing on allegations of bribery, fraud and breach of trust to four days.

Thousands of Russians rallied in Moscow to demand the release of protesters jailed during a rash of political demonstrations this summer.

The party of former Austrian Chancellor Sebastian Kurz won an election months after his government collapsed.

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

September 30, 2019 02:47 ET (06:47 GMT)
